title: How to Add Gluten to Flour

steps.headline: Add the vital wheat gluten on a per-recipe basis and not to the entire bag of flour.
steps.description: The standard gluten/flour ratio is 1 tbsp. (15 ml) for every 2 to 3 cups (473 ml to 711 ml) of flour.

steps.headline: Mix in the vital wheat gluten before you add the other dry ingredients once you have determined how to add gluten to flour.
steps.description: Add your flour to a bowl, add the gluten and mix it together with a fork or pour it into a sifter and sift it into a fresh bowl.

steps.headline: Combine your wet ingredients per the instructions in your bread recipe.
steps.description: Once you have mixed the gluten into the flour you can use it as you would any other flour.
